ArabicText: أَبَـرْقٌ بَـدَى نَحْوَ المَرَابِعِ يَلْمَعُ * فَهَبْنِى امْــرَءًا إِذْ يَلْمَعُ البَرْقُ يَدْمَعُ
EnglishText: Was it a lightening that appeared shining towards the houses? so (kindly) consider me a person who shed tears whenever the lightening shines.

ArabicText: لمَحْتَ بـِـوَهْنٍ وَيْكَ هِجْتَ صَبَابَة* وَرَقْـــرَاقَ دَمْعٍ سَاعَةَ الحَىِّ تَهْجَعُ
EnglishText: You took a lackadaisical glance, woe to you! You have arouse longing and a flood of tears when the neighbours are slumbering.

ArabicText: تُذَكِّرُ أَيَّامَ الصِّبَا وَهْـيَ قَدْ مَـضَتْ * وَلَـمْ يَبْقَ إِلاَّ لـَــوْعَةٌ وَتَـوَجُّعُ
EnglishText: You are remembering the days of childhood which left save love-sickeness and ailment

ArabicText: سَقَى اللهُ أَرْضًا بـِـالمَدِينَةِ إِنَّــهَا * مَحَطُّ رِحَـالٍ فِيـهِ حَـرْقِيَ يُرْقَعُ
EnglishText: May Allah irrigate a land at al-Madinah, verily, it’s the station of spiritual travelers. It is there my tatter was patched.

ArabicText: دِيـَـارُ حَبِيبِ اللهِ وَهـُـــوَ أَمِينُهُ *  دِيِارٌ بِـــهَا تُلْفَى المرَافِقُ أَجْمَعُ
EnglishText: You are remembering the days of childhood which left save love-sickeness and ailment

ArabicText: دِيَـارٌ لِمَنْ هَـامَ الفُـؤَادُ بِحُبِّـهِ * وَتَـذْكَارُهُ لِلْقَلْبِ مَــرْعًى وَمَرْ تَعُ
EnglishText: It is an abode of whom the heart is infatuated with his love and commemorating him is a pasturage and comfort for the heart.

ArabicText: دِيَـارٌ لأِعْلَى الخَلْقِ خُلْقًا وَخِلْـقَةً*دِيَارٌ لِــمَنْ فِي الخَلْقِ يُعْطِى وَيَمْنَعُ
EnglishText: tIt is an abode of the most exalted (of all) creations morally and physically. It is an abode of he who gives and denies among the creations.

ArabicText: وَأَكْرَمِهِمْ نَفْسًا وَصِهْــرًا وَنِسْبَةً * وَعِلْمًا وَآدَابـًـا وَأَتْقَـى وَأَخْشَعُ
EnglishText: He is the most honoured of them all in term of soul (spirituality), in lawship, affinity, knowledge, decorum, piety and solemnity.

ArabicText: فَقَدْ كَانَ خَيْرُ الخَلْقِ فَخْمًا مُفَخَّصًا * وَذُو هَيْبَـةٍ وَالمَشْـيُ فِيهِ تَقَلـُّـعُ
EnglishText: Indeed, the best of creations has being a venerated great personality, highly esteemed and his style of walking is elegantly free.

ArabicText: وَأَزْهَرُ لَوْنٍ أَدْعَجُ العَيْنِ تَـزْدَرِى *  بِعَيْنِ مَهَى عِنْدَ الخَمِيلَةِ تَـــرْتَعُ
EnglishText: He is of pale color, black eyes that devalue the beauty of bull-eyes that are always opened with his eyelash.

ArabicText: وَأَنْجَلُ عَيْنٍ أَهْدَبُ الشَّفْـرِ وَاسِعٌ * جَبِينُ رَسـُولِ اللهِ وَالخُلْقُ أَوْسَعُ
EnglishText: He is of big eyeballs, abundant eyelid. The messenger of Allah is of broad brow and broad nature.

ArabicText: أَزَجُّ وَأَقْنَـى وَجْهُ طَـهَ مُــدَوَّرٌ * وَلِحْيَتُهُ كَثًّــا وَصَــدْرٌ مُوَسَّعُ
EnglishText: tHe is of perfect eyebrow, aquiline nose, Taha’s face is round, his beard thick and (his) chest is broad.

ArabicText: وَمَنْكِبُهُ أَعْظِمْ بِــهِ وَعِظَامُـهُ * ضِخَامٌ وَرَبْعُ الَقَـدِّ طَـــهَ المُرَفَّعُ
EnglishText: What a magnificent is his shoulder, a hefty and of a moderate height is Taha, the exalted.

ArabicText: كَذَا عَضُـدُّ عَبْلٌ وَعَبْلٌ ذِرَاعُـهُ * مُـرَحَّبُ رَاحَاتٍ وَالأَنْــوَارُ تَلْمَعُ
EnglishText: Thus are his arms beefy, he is of wine palms and his teethes shine.

ArabicText: وَسَائِلُ أَطْــرَافٍ وَغَيْرُ مُشَذَّبٍ*عَظِيمُ كَــرَادِيسٍ مِنَ الخَلْقِ أَرْفَعُ
EnglishText: tHis fingers are moderate and not skinny. He is of great joints, relatively excellent.

ArabicText: وَأَشْنَبُ ثَغْـرٍ إِنْ تَبَسَّمَ يَنْجَلـِى * كَحَبِّ غَـمَامٍ أَوْ لَـكَالبَرْقِ يَلْمَعُ
EnglishText: He has perfect set of white teeth which appeared whenever he smiled like an ice-block.

ArabicText: وَهَـامَتُهُ عُظْمَى لِشَعْـرٍ تَـرَجُّلٌ*وَخَـافِضُ طَرْفٍ سَاكِتٌ فَهُوَ يَخْشَعُ
EnglishText: His head is great (big) for his abundant hair. He is a lowest of his gaze and quiet in humbleness.

ArabicText: وَأَحْـزَانُـهُ مَـوْ صُـولَةٌ بِتَفَكُّرٍ*وَإِنْ قَالَ قَالَ الـفَصْلَ وَالحَقَّ يَرْجِعُ
EnglishText: His anguish was connected to contemplation and whenever he spoke he says distinguished words and the truth that prevails.

ArabicText: وَيَنْظُرُ لَحْظًا وَهُـوَ لِلأَرْضِ غَالِبًا * يَـــسُوقُ صِحَابًا وَالْمَلاَئِكُ  تَتْبِعُ
EnglishText: He did look in most cases towards the ground (i.e. lowering his gaze). He did lead the companions while angels did follow.

ArabicText: وَجِيدُ رَسُـولِ اللهِ يُشْبِـهُ دُمْيَةً * إِذَا فَـرَّقَ الأَشْـــعَارَ يَبْدُو وَيَلْمَعُ
EnglishText: The neck of the Apostle of Allah is reddish whenever he parted the hair, it appeared shined.

ArabicText: وَكَاللُّؤْلُؤِ المَكْنُونِ وَالمِسْكِ عَرْقُهُ * فَمِثْلَ رَسُــولِ اللهِ لَمْ يَحْظَ مَجْمَعُ
EnglishText: He is like well-guarded pearls and his sweat is pleasant like Musk. Thus, the life (of the qualities) of the messenger of Allah was never met.

ArabicText: وَأَحْلَـمُ خَلْقِ اللهِ أَعْـدَلُ خَلْقِهِ*مِنَ النَّاسِ أَسْخَى بَلْ مِنَ النَّاسِ أَشْجَعُ
EnglishText: He is the most forebearant of all men, the most perfect in creation, the most generous of all men, he is rather the bravest of all men.

ArabicText: وَيَخْدُمُ لِلأَهْلِينَ يَخْصِفُ نَعْلَـهُ * وَيَقْطَـعُ لَحْمًا وَهُــوَ لِلثَّوْبِ يَرْقَعُ
EnglishText: He did serve his family, repair his shoes by himself, cut meat and parch his cloth by himself.

ArabicText: أَشَدُّ حَـيَاءً وَهْوَ يَأْتِى لِمَنْ دَعَا * وَيَــغْضَبُ لِلْمَوْلَى إِلَى الحَقِّ يَرْجِعُ
EnglishText: He is highly bashful, he did honour invitations. His exasperation (fury) is for (the course of) Allah and he return to Allah in all affairs.

ArabicText: وَلَمْ يَتَـوَرَّعْ عَنْ حَلاَلٍ وَلَوْ حَلاَ * وَلَمْ تُلْفِهِ فِـى غَالِـبِ الوَقْتِ يَشْبَعُ
EnglishText: He is highly bashful, he did honour invitations. His exasperation (fury) is for (the course of) Allah and he return to Allah in all affairs.

ArabicText: وَيُـرْكَبُ أَحْـيَانًا جَوَادًا وَمَرَّةً * حِـمَارًا وَحِينًا رَاجـِــلاً يَـتَقَلَّعُ
EnglishText: At times, he did ride on steed and sometime on a donkey and in some cases. He treks

ArabicText: كَذَالِكَ فِى المَلْبُوسِ وَالطِّيبُ فَائِحٌ*يُجَالِسُ أَقْـوَامًا  وَالأَصْوَاتُ تُرْفَعُ
EnglishText: Thus, he is (moderate and humble) in his dressing and application of scent, he did sit group of people while their voices were raised loudly.

ArabicText: وَيَمْـزَحُ أَحْـيَانًا يُوَلِّفُ مَـرَّةً*وَمَا هَـابَ مُلْكًا قَطُّ فَالشَّانُ أَرْفَعُ
EnglishText: At times he did crack jokes, forge relationship (among people). He never stood, for once, in awe of any tyrant. His affairs are, indeed, great.

ArabicText: وَمَا حَقَّرَ المِسْكِينَ يَدْعُو جَمِيعَهُمْ*وَبِاللهِ مَـوْلَى الخَلْقِ ذَا الخَلْقَ يَجْمَعُ
EnglishText: He never humiliated paupers, he interacted with them, to God be the glory for the good morals he possessed.

ArabicText: وَأَكْرَمَهُ المَوْلَى أَجَلَّ كَــرَامَةٍ * وَخَصَّصَـهُ مَنْ لِلْخـَـلاَئـقِ يَنْفَعُ
EnglishText: (Allah) the Absolute Master honoured him and He who benefits the whole of creatures distinguished him.

ArabicText: عَلَيْـهِ صَــلاَةُ اللهِ مـَا ذَرَّ شَارِقٌ*وَغَنَّتْ حَمَامَاتٌ عَلَى الغُصْنِ تَسْجَعُ
EnglishText: May blessing and peace of Allah be upon him whenever the sun shines and whenever pigeons chant coo on the stems (of trees).

ArabicText: وَمَا رُدَّ ضَيْمُ الدَّهْرُ عَنْ سَاحَةِ الَّذِى*يُزَخْرِفُ أَمْدَاحًا وَيَشْدُوا وَيَسْجَعُ
EnglishText: And whenever veranda of one who eulogizes (the prophet) fascinatingly sings and chants, is protected against life adversities.

ArabicText: وَآلِ وَأَصْحَابٍ مَدَى قَوْلِ شَـيِّقٍ * أَبَرْقٌ بَدَا نَحْوَ الْـمَرَابِعِ يَلْـمَعُ
EnglishText: May the blessing include his household and his companion as far as the lover says: was it a lightening that appeared shinning towards the houses?
